intro: Megaclinium ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's sedge, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flower heads. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats such as meadows and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
